de.mrapp.android.util

Class Condition

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.Condition

  • public final class Condition
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class, which provides static methods, which allow to ensure, that variables and objects fulfill certain conditions. If a condition is not violated, an exception is thrown by each of these methods.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • ensureTrue

        public static void ensureTrue(boolean expression,
                              java.lang.String exceptionMessage)
        Ensures, that a specific boolean expression is true. Otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        expression - The boolean expression, which should be checked, as a Boolean value
        exceptionMessage - The message of the exception, which is thrown, if the given boolean expression is not true, as a String or null, if the exception should not have a message

        exceptionMessage - The message of the exception, which is thrown, if the given boolean expression is not true, as a String or null, if the exception should not have a message

        Ensures, that a Double value is at maximum as great as a reference value. Otherwise an IllegalArgumentException with a specific message is thrown.
        Parameters:
        value - The value, which should be checked, as a Double value
        referenceValue - The reference value, the given value must be at maximum as great as, as a Double value
        exceptionMessage - The message of the exception, which is thrown, if the given value is greater as the reference value, as a String or null, if the exception should not have a message
